text: Do you recommend using semicolons after every statement in JavaScript?
In many situations, JavaScript parsers will insert semicolons for you if you leave them out.
My question is, do you leave them out?
I'll post simple Yes/No answers as a poll, but I'm also interested in your reasons.
If you're unfamiliar with the rules, there's a description of semicolon insertion on the Mozilla site.
That description may be incomplete, because it doesn't explain @Dreas's example.
Anybody have a link to the complete rules, or see why the example gets a semicolon?
This stackoverflow question is related, but only talks about a specific scenario.
